question.text: Which one of the following the genus name, its two characters and its class/phylum are correctly matched?

options.text:
Genus Two characters Class/phylum
Salamandra (i) A tympanum represents ear (ii) Fertilization is external Amphibia

Genus Two characters Class/phylum
Pteropus (i) Skin possesses hair (ii) Oviparous Mammalia

Genus Two characters Class/phylum
Aurelia (i) Cnidoblast (ii) Organ level of organization Coelenterata

Genus Two characters Class/phylum
Ascaris (i) Body segmented (ii) Males and females distinct Annelida

solution.text: Pteropus (flying foxes) belongs to Class Mammalia. The only platypus is an egg-laying mammal and thus flying foxes are viviparous. Aurelia is a jellyfish. These belong to Phylum Coelenterata. These are also known as Cnidaria due to the presence of Cnidoblast stinging cells. This phylum shows the tissue level of organization. Ascaris belongs to Phylum Aschelminthes and these are hermaphrodites. Salamanders are tailed amphibians. These lack external ears and fertilization is external.
